verses.roman:
yā hy upayuñjānānāṁ mukha-nirvāsito vāyuḥ
samantāc chata-yojanam anuvāsayati

synonyms: yāḥ—which (those flows of honey); hi—indeed; upayuñjānānām—of those who drink; mukha-nirvāsitaḥ vāyuḥ—the air emanating from the mouths; samantāt—all around; śata-yojanam—up to one hundred yojanas (eight hundred miles); anuvāsayati—makes sweetly flavored.
translation: The air carrying the scent from the mouths of those who drink that honey perfumes the land for a hundred yojanas around.
